definition[0]: used to introduce the first and most important point you want to make
example[0]: Well, to begin with, he shouldn’t even have been driving my car.
definition[1]: used to say that something was already in a particular condition before something else happened
example[1]: I didn’t break it! It was like that to begin with.
definition[2]: during the first part of a process or activity
example[2]: The kids helped me to begin with, but they soon got bored.
